positive.review: This is a wholesome family-friendly experience if your family is made of heavily armed lunatics.

KF2 is an overall fun game to play, I got it on another platform for free, and bought it on Steam to make it easier to play with friends. Well worth the money that I put out for it. You can play solo offline or you can play with friends or online with find a match and get matched with others playing the game. Would suggest to friends to play. 10/10

The same good-old bloody and chaotic mess from KF1!
... just ... even bloodier and messier.
This is definitely my favorite hoard shooter. Maybe not "better" than Helldivers but i find it a lot more satisfying.

Pro: Although the game is simple, it's super fun with friends.

Con: It isn't very optimised, I also get very high ping.

Still, a very strong recommend for the price.

its better than KF3 but not better than KF1 has its own perks. Sad to have to play this the other 2 when as a modern gamer look forward to non-fuckup-paywall-trash-ass games. KF3 is that. So i will only play KF1-2
stoopid fucking monkeys.
great replayability, fun with friends and the different difficulties provide a real challange

My husband and I love playing this game. We are achievement hunters, so this was right up our alley. We each have our classes that we are partial to, but the level designs are impressive, allowing you the ability to kite in most sticky situations. It has just the right amount of kiting, hold ups, strategies and guns blazing to get a thumbs up.

Killing Floor 2 is a raucous good time and a damn good sequel to perhaps the greatest co-op survival FPS ever made. Just a year after Nazi Zombies rattled the gaming world in Call of Duty: World at War in 2008, the original Killing Floor was an easy to pick-up-and-play but hard-to-master zombie survival shooter that was well-balanced and riddled with replayability. Like any good sequel, Killing Floor 2 expands greatly upon the first game's mechanics and offers a dense content-rich experience, one that's enjoyable alone and even better enjoyed with friends. 

The game looks absolutely stunning with its highly detailed and refined level of graphical fidelity while its performance remains smooth as butter, even when action is at its most frantic. You can quite literally decorate entire sprawling maps with blood and gibs and it'll never disappear or affect the game's framerate. It's nothing short of a true technical marvel.

Though the game is packed with micro-transactions and cosmetic foolery like most modern games, it never interferes with how the game plays or becomes a nuisance. When all is said and done, Killing Floor 2 is an incredibly fun and rewarding experience with tons of replay value. A game that truly does look as good as it plays, Killing Floor 2 is, without a doubt, the Grand Puba of co-op survival shooters.
---
Overall: 9.5/10

Score: 3.5/5
Pretty good multi-player PvE horror-focused (zombies primarily) game with fairly short rounds/missions.

Not worth the $30 price tag, but I got it on heavy discount and feel good about my time with it. There are simply too many other great games I would rather spend my time with at the end of this 30 hour stint.


1. A lot of variety: weapons, explosives, support powers/equipment, playstyles, enemies, level designs.
2. Matches tend to be pretty challenging at mid-and-high tier difficulties. Enemies are aggressive and not easy to cheese from what I could tell. You have quite a bit to manage in the moment-to-moment gameplay and each round/match as a whole too: resources, positioning, (groups of) enemies and what should be prioritized.
3. Good QoL features, low skill floor, teamwork is rewarded, many support classes. You can share resources with other members of your team. Matches 
4. Temporary upgrades during each mission feel pretty fair relative to the ramping difficulty as the rounds get closer to the boss, and so does the meta-progression.
5. Music is solid, fits the action-horror themes/atmosphere, and fairly unique (a lot of heavy metal) in my experience with multi-player shooters.
Very fun co-op game and even better with friends. Even after 9 years this game still holds up nicely. Too bad Killing Floor 3 is nowhere near as good as this gem.
This game was really fun to play, hopefully they are still supporting it, if not that would suck

its great but im not having as much fun cuz my gpu is donky with this game 
good game though 
still i might perfer kf1

Very fun, challenging, and time consuming game! Even 9 years later there are still hundreds of players and tons of lobbies to join. Pretty easy to play offline or solo for normal or hard mode matches. Team up with others to take down survival or hell on earth difficulties. Level up your perks to get really strong bonus, buffs, and powers. Takes quite a while to get all of the achievements.
got to use an exploding sniper and cause a chain reaction of bile explosions, 10/10. would buy killing floor 3 if i had the funds rn

Although my experience is still minimal when it comes to the Killing Floor series, this game is great for horror/fps and heavy gore related gameplay! I will not be touching Killing Floor 3 till they get their stuff together while you can get the same if not better experience from the previous titles. Still a joy to go jumping around and exploding everything in sight looking for those little collectibles in each map. Having said that, finding this game on sale is the best bet considering the age of the product. However, I believe this game is still really great nonetheless ^_^
If you like gunplay and zombies, then this game is a solid choice. The visuals are fantastic, gameplay is fun and engaging, and very replayable. Definitely reccommend it.

As a fan of old school COD zombies this is a different experience but that doesn't make it any less fun. It took some time for me to understand the class system and how it works but it's really fun. Solo or friends it's worth playing. I just don't play much because my PC is slow currently and I game on my Series X. I don't have it on my Series X yet.
perfect gameplay loop for a big co-op group of pals. idk about playing it solo,

In a vacuum, KF2 is a fantastic game. Some of the most fun gunplay in the FPS genre, excellent enemy variety, decent map design, sufficient Britishness. But as a sequel to KF1? I'm not so sure.

For one, it's significantly easier. Suicidal difficulty in this game feels like hard mode in KF1. The addition of Sprint and Bash are a pretty big contributor to this. If you were surrounded by a mob of zeds in the first game, you were dead to rights and rightfully punished for having bad positioning. Now, you can just run past the horde with no consequences. Running and gunning is pretty much the way to go now since hunkering down and welding doors got a massive nerf (doors don't repair themselves after a wave and require a Support Specialist to repair them again) which sucks because the feeling of holding the line and mowing down zeds in a corridor is magical.

Another factor is that every perk and weapon is homogenized. The upgrade system means that there's no need to buy high-tier weapons since you can just upgrade your starting weapons. I really don't see the point of this? At that point your choice of weapon is meaningless since anything can be powerful. As for the perks, it's a similar situation in that all perks can do anything well. In KF1, perks had specific niches. Sharpshooter took care of large zeds, Firebug eliminated trash zeds, Field Medic (obviously) kept the team healed, etc... Now Firebug has microwave guns to kill large zeds, nearly every perk has a healing weapon of their own now, and even Demo can take an ability that eliminates his bombs' weakness to Sirens. Now that everyone is special, no one is.

The final (and most damning imo) downgrade is the aesthetic. Gone are the gritty grindhouse horror vibes of the original, now replaced with squeaky-clean sci-fi and Team Fortress 2-levels of lacking a cohesive artstyle with all the ridiculous glowing cosmetics. The grungy Industrial and Heavy Metal soundtrack was replaced with... Christian Metal? WTF? The new trader is also annoying as hell, and so are a lot of the playable characters (seriously, they NEVER SHUT UP), but they grew on me eventually (NOT THE TRADER). You can't even [INSULT PLAYERS] with the dialogue wheel anymore. Literally unplayable

Okay, I've complained a lot, but I really do enjoy this game. It's just a little disappointing that it doesn't quite live up to its predecessor, which is one of the best co-op shooters of all time. Still better than whatever the fuck KF3 is lmao

An amazing game, every single class is fun to use

I've only had this game for a month and a half and I've played 177 hours, including solo and co-op, and I LOVE IT! It's a great successor to KF1.

There's only three things I don't like so much - or rather, two things that annoys me and one thing I don't like. It annoys me how trying to play solo restricts your playstyle and perk selection SO MUCH. (Perk doesn't have extra movement speed? Not usually a great one to use in high-difficulty solo play!)

The thing I really don't like is the $2.50 keys to open the loot crates. In 177 hours of play, I've earned 33 crates. That would cost $82.50 to open them all. If this were a free-to-play game, I wouldn't mind that. But it isn't. This game has been out for 9 years now and the keys are still $2.50. It already has a sequel out (which absolutely bombed, but my point still stands), make the crates free (or at least cheaper) to open, please? Also, you lose more points for having such a RIDICULOUS number of cosmetic items and a 'gear equip' menu with no sorting function.

The second thing that annoys me is that you can't just have someone host a LAN multiplayer game (or even directly host a game without running a server). And if you want to play a private game with a group of people, you'd better hope the official server it picks has a good ping (we tried multiple times and the automatically selected server had a really poor connection).

TL;DR: Great game! No local hosting iffy. Attempted over-monetization bad. Excessive cosmetics bad. But not bad enough to stop me from leaving a 'recommend this game.'
this game is amazing and you are a loser for not playing it

I'll throw in a recipe for Varenyky.

Recipe for Potato Dumplings (Varenyky)
Ingredients:
For the dough:
Wheat flour – 500 g
Water – 200 ml
Egg – 1
Salt – 1 tsp
For the filling:
Potatoes – 1 kg
Onions – 2
Lard or butter – 50 g
Salt – to taste
Ground black pepper – to taste
Preparation steps:
Making the dough:
Sifting the flour: Sift the flour into a large bowl.
Making the dough: Add salt and the egg to the flour. Gradually pour in the water, constantly stirring. Knead the dough until it becomes smooth and elastic.
Resting the dough: Wrap the dough in plastic wrap or cover it with a towel and let it rest for 30 minutes.
Preparing the filling:
Boiling the potatoes: Peel the potatoes, cut them into large pieces, and boil until tender in salted water.
Preparing the onions: While the potatoes are boiling, finely chop the onions. Sauté the onions in lard or butter until golden brown.
Making the potato puree: Drain the potatoes and mash them. Add the sautéed onions, salt, and pepper to taste, and mix well.
Forming the dumplings:
Rolling out the dough: Roll out the dough into a thin sheet about 2-3 mm thick. Use a glass or cutter to cut out circles approximately 7-8 cm in diameter.
Forming the dumplings: Place a spoonful of potato filling on each circle of dough. Fold the dough in half and pinch the edges tightly to seal the dumplings.
Cooking the dumplings:
Boiling water: Bring a large pot of water to a boil, add salt.
Cooking the dumplings: Gently drop the dumplings into the boiling water, stirring carefully to prevent sticking. Cook until done (approximately 5-7 minutes after they float to the surface).
Serving:
Removing the dumplings: Remove the dumplings with a slotted spoon and place them on a plate.
Serving: Serve the dumplings hot, optionally drizzling with melted butter, sour cream, or sautéed onions.
Enjoy your meal!

negative.review:
Great, fun game ruined by monetization and huge useless bloat, wich would all be solved by file compression, optimization and an option to only download the necessary files.

Bought it on a sale for like a dolar and somehow I still feel ripped off, I'd rather pay 10x the price for a stripped down version. Everything designed to get money from you makes this game worse, as many others.

This thing wants 95gb of disk space, around 30gb of pure cosmetic bloat.

You are a cash cow to these companies and they have no respect for you.

Although it is a game with melancholic graphics and style, it is very unpleasant that the bosses are very unbalanced in multiplayer. It is easier to play in 6 than in 2-3, because the difficulty and reduced damage are not balanced linearly. Also sometimes weapons disappear, and the melee ones are difficult to use.
Game sucks ass now. I couldn't get to get into a match, not even offline, until I installed the epic games launcher.

To be honest, Tripwire must be on deep Shit. Lost their way with the new game, terrible comunity support, perk reset to level 0 with no way to get my progress back... played it for years o nconsole and hours on the first one, a shame to be honest...

Expected a good zombie shooter game, because of all the positive reviews. This game just lacks an objective (holding zones and welding isn't fun) , got easily bored by the waves and 5 bosses.
I don't like levelling classes as this makes game too slow at the start.

at least shooting is satisfying :]
Optimization on GTX-series? NAH. Normal launching on gtx 1070 (as i know it has +3.7 performance than RTX 3050) NAH.
Expected a COD zombie like experience, its not. Too many spongy enemies overall not very fun

KF2 started off alright but this franchise has been mismanaged by TW for years. 

KF1 is still peak co-op gaming though.

this game is like left 4 dead, minus any of the fun. The entire game feels like an arcade mode of any other zombie fps, which brings up the question "where is the rest of the game?"  if you're looking to do endless waves of unexciting enemies, this is the game for you.
They made this to convince you of the lie that Texas is real, BUT ITS NOT AND I FEAR NOT THE MACHINATIONS OF THE ANTICHRIST
trash game from trash developers
only play this game if you have any friend
buggy game
Inconsistent dogshit
Devs are gone man, I'll be outside.

I think the recent hotfix made this game unlaunchable. I just see the splash screen and then it just stops. No Crash log, no title screen. Nothing. A shame since I was able to play it before. For now, it's not starting at all. And yes I did verify game files. Like 3 or 4 times
After playing this game for 500 hours, I have come to the conclusion that it sucks.

This is a microtransaction sh*tfest. No real effort is put in this game except new microtransactions. The devs try to steal your lunch money every way possible. I mean.. 2 months in and KF3 is in Mostly Negative territory, and that's their newest release. 
I would buy this game only if it's less than 4$, otherwise don't bother. There are plenty of other fun games.

idk WHY but they replaced the trader with a french robot(really whats the reason with this?). and only 1 character is bri'ish now... i cant play a killing floor game without 5 bri'ish men yelling. for these reasons the first game is better

Although it is a game with melancholic graphics and style, it is very unpleasant that the bosses are very unbalanced in multiplayer. It is easier to play in 6 than in 2-3, because the difficulty and reduced damage are not balanced linearly. Also sometimes weapons disappear, and the melee ones are difficult to use.

Well, it is what it is - KF1 with a weird futuristic spin. Just as repetitive, if not more, despite the fact that there's a few bosses now instead of just one. It was 90% off so whatever, but honestly KF1 with mods is more entertaining. Combat / movement here worse in comparison and.. it's 100 gigs!!!

absolutely no crossplay and no updates anymore as far as i can tell so just save your money if you and your friends want to play because pc can only play with pc players, xbox can only play with xbox players, same with playstation.
